body.name: Graceless : A Tropical Authors Novella (Tropical Adventure Series Book 1)
body.description: Tropical Authors Where Adventure meets the Water If you love mysteries, thrillers and suspense featuring boats, planes, diving, and nautical locations, then come see us at Tropical Authors. You'll find all the best-selling authors in the genre under one roof with links to their books and audiobooks wherever they're sold. Collaborative Projects Beginning with Graceless, our authors are collaborating on novels and novellas showcasing their work and promoting the genre. Look for updates on our website.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Tropical Authors Where Adventure meets the Water If you love mysteries, thrillers and suspense featuring boats, planes, diving, and nautical locations, then come see us at Tropical Authors. You'll find all the best-selling authors in the genre under one roof with links to their books and audiobooks wherever they're sold. Collaborative Projects Beginning with Graceless, our authors are collaborating on novels and novellas showcasing their work and promoting the genre. Look for updates on our website. Join our crew for... Twice monthly newsletters Promos from our authors Release details Fun and interesting stories New authors added all the time

GRACELESS - FOUR AUTHORS... ONE WILD RIDE Wayne Stinnett Author of the Jesse McDermitt and Charity Styles series. A Veteran of the United States Marine Corps, as is his main character, Jesse McDermitt, Wayne grew up in Melbourne, Florida, and has also lived in the Florida Keys, Bahamas, and Cozumel, Mexico, among other places. John H Cunningham Author of the Buck Reilly Adventure series. John has either lived in or visited the many locations that populate his novels, and he mixes fact with fiction and often includes real people in the cast of characters. He splits his time between New York, Virginia, and Key West. Nick Sullivan Author of The Deep Series. Born in East Tennessee, Nick has spent most of his adult life as an actor in New York City, working in theater, television, film, and audiobooks. An avid scuba diver for many years, his travels to numerous Caribbean islands have inspired The Deep Series. Nicholas Harvey Author of the AJ Bailey Adventure and Nora Sommer Caribbean Suspense series. Nick's life has been anything but ordinary. Race car driver, mountaineer, divemaster, and since 2020 a full-time novelist. Raised in England, Nick now lives next to the ocean in Key Largo.
All proceeds from these projects fund the website, newsletter, and promotion of Tropical Authors. Visit our website for an Endless supply of books from our best-selling authors!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic concept and execution
reviews.reviewText: I loved this book. Very much enjoyed reading the afterwords that explained how the project came about. I had read several of Wayne Stinnett's books but the others were new to me. I read the authors afterwords prior to reading their contributions to the story and knew I was in for a treat when the afterwords were so funny that I read passages from them to my patient wife who was trying to read her book. She rushed me to finish so she could start it when she finished her book. I immediately purchased the full length book before I wrote this review., something I never do.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I loved this Caribbean adventure novella!
reviews.reviewText: I'm a huge fan of Wayne Stinnett's books, I've read and re-read them multiple times. He's just a great writer.This time he crafts a tale w 3 other writers I am unfamiliar with. It's a marvelous collaboration. Exciting, intriguing plot filled w delightful and endearing characters, it's a win-win. Except it's too damn short!!! Read it in about an hour I think.Keep up the good work, gentlemen!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This was a very interesting story. It certainly kept me reading. I know some will say this is far fetched but after watching a docu-series on the CIA, I’m not so sure that it is.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Review of Graceless: A Tropical Authors Novella, book 1
reviews.reviewText: This was a well written fast paced story by four great authors that reads like it was written by one. Nathan and his wife had purchased a 38 ft used Sailboat and planned on taking a Caribbean cruise in it. Nathan breaks a tooth on a date seed and has to stay home for two days to get a crown to replace it. His wife will meet him in the Cayman Isles and is going to sail their new boat with a highly recommended sailor. Unfortunately after his tooth repair on the second day he gets notification that their boat has sunk and his wife Grace is missing. The saga begins in the Cayman’s, goes to Cozumel, then Key West and lastly to Marathon. Great story, tons of action and intrigue. A fun relaxing read and kudos to Nick Sullivan, John H Cunningham, Nicholas Harvey and Wayne Stinnet for a great story!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars WOW! What an adventure! What a ride!
reviews.reviewText: I have long been a fan of Wayne Stinnett and his character, Jesse McDermitt. I love the way Wayne has collaborated with other writers of his genre and given space to the characters of his author friends. Graceless was a great adventure and I loved every minute of the read. I have read a couple of John Cunningham's Buck Reilly series. Now, after this great adventure I plan to read the entire Buck Reilly series and to get better acquainted with AJ Baily in Nicholas Harvey's AJ Baily Adventure series and Nick Sullivan's entire Deep series. Thanks to the wonderful team of writers I have a few months more great reading to look forward to.I very rarely give a 5 star rating to anything. To get 5 stars from me means a stellar adventure awaits inside the stories. Great character development, a non-stop adventure ride; the stories pull you in and you simply cannot put the books down until you reach the end.Thank you Wayne, Nicholas, Nick and John. I hope to spend many more hours enjoying the adventures of your characters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2022
reviews.reviewText: When I started this book, I didn't know what to expect. I am a huge fan of Wayne Stinnett and had not read any of the other authors. Reading Stinnett's books are such a great escape! So when I saw Jesse McDermitt was a part of this, I was not going miss to this. So very glad I picked this up!As it's mentioned in the afterward, each author writes a section as it pertains to their popular characters with Nathan as the central character who ties them all together. The plot was perfect! And it was like seeing Jesse in a whole new way!I now want to pick up the books for the other three authors and read more about their characters! I'm not going to reveal more about the story because you just have to read it. But if you like any of the authors, you are going to love this!Looking forward to reading the next collaboration!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Amazing read,fast paced action in the Floridian seas !
reviews.reviewText: Trying to recover his wife risking his life in a fast paced history at the floridian waters,running at fast boats and dangerous criminals.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The tropical adventure genre is one of my favorites and I'd read books from each of these authors except Mr. Harvey previously -- that's going to change! It was great to see characters I really like interacting in the same story. I purchases Timeless as soon as I finished😊

Non stop action with descriptions of south Florida and the Caribbean so well tailored that you feel like you are there.Fast paced plot with twists and turns that have you accepting their unrealism but enjoying the adventure.A very quick read because the book is difficult to put down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 7, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Avery good story which keeps the reader guessing and trying to predict the direction of travel, just to find it runs elsewhere.It is quite surprising that the authors could fit appropriately all their lead characters into ne story.
A real good read with non stop action in this adventure fiction book. I hope you enjoy as much as Inhave.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 5, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I was amazed by the professionalism of the writers. I was afraid that the story would be bitty, but the separate sections joined so seamlessly that apart from the different characters helping Nathan the story flowed seamlessly. It was very enjoyable to see how the different characters fitted into their part of the story so well. A very easy book to read - again very hard to put down. I would recommend this book to fans of diving, the Caribbean, mystery novels.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 24, 2022
reviews.reviewText: A great amalgamation of four distinguished writers (I found new authors to follow). The story is full of intrigue, action and hardworking honest people willing to help a soul in need.
